bench.gen

Class GenSegmentBase.Condition

  • java.lang.Object
    • bench.gen.GenSegmentBase.Condition
  • Enclosing class:
    GenSegmentBase

    protected static class GenSegmentBase.Condition
extends java.lang.Object
    Internal class to compute a boolean condition. This class supports the 'while' parameter for various segment types. It allows boolean operators "=", "<" and ">". The operands can be $variable expressions, or integer constants.

    The constructor parses the input condition string and sets up the comparison. Each invocation of test() requires that you pass in a GenSegmentBase to provide access to the getIntParam() method

    • Constructor Detail

      • GenSegmentBase.Condition

        protected GenSegmentBase.Condition(java.lang.String expr)
        If the original condition string cannot be determined, because of integer conversion errors, etc, this routine will print an error message, then return true. Variables are reevaluated every time
        Parameters:
        expr - An input string from the genxml template representing an integer value.

    • Method Detail

      • test

        public boolean test(GenSegmentBase seg)
        Determine the current boolean value of the condition. Variable operands are recomputed, based on the Variables table of the segment passed in, and using defaults that will ensure a return of 'true' if they are invalid. The appropriate operator is applied, and the comparative value returned.
        Parameters:
        seg - A segment containing the variables used in expansion of operands.
        Returns:
        False if the condition can be determined and is not true, true otherwise.
